Max Welz

I am a second-year PhD candidate in statistics at the Econometric Institute at the Erasmus University Rotterdam, where I am blessed to be supervised by Patrick Groenen and Andreas Alfons. I am also affiliated with the Department of Public Health at Erasmus Medical Center (MC).

My research interests are (see my research page for details):

  • Robust statistics with non-continuous data;
  • Mathematical statistics (Empirical processes and high-dimensional models);
  • Statistical computing and computational statistics;
  • Applied statistics and field-specific problem solving, in particular in medicine, psychology, and economics.

Moreover, I am a proud member of the Open Science Community Rotterdam, the Institute of Mathematical Statistics, and the International Association for Statistical Computing.

If you want to get in touch, feel free to email me at welz@SPAM0.nl or m.welz@SPAM1.nl, but you need to replace SPAM0 with ese.eur and SPAM1 with erasmusmc, respectively.

News

Jul 30, 2021 We will present the project Outlier Detection in Rating-Scale Data via Autoencoders (joint work with Andreas Alfons) at ICORS 2021 in Vienna, Austria (Sep. 21–24, 2021). Working paper coming soon!
Jul 16, 2021 Together with Andreas Alfons (Econometic Institute) and Kevin ten Haaf (Erasmus MC), I was awarded a grant of ~€20,000 from the Open Mind Call 2021 for our CITRUS project.
Jul 9, 2021 The (virtual) conference DSSV-ECDA 2021, which I co-organized as webmaster, successfully completed. We welcomed over 220 participants from all over the world.
Email addresses: welz@SPAM0.nl and m.welz@SPAM1.nl, but you need to replace SPAM0 with ese.eur and SPAM1 with erasmusmc, respectively.
